node.title: Can We Help the Homeless?
node.description: Why it’s so difficult to find viable solutions for California’s homelessness crisis.

node.title: Toyota will spend $1.3 billion on a N.C. electric car battery plant.
node.description: The plant, which will employ 1,750 people, will be located outside of Greensboro.

node.title: Afghanistan's National Museum Staff Working Unpaid Since August as Taliban Patrol Grounds
node.description: The National Museum of Afghanistan in Kabul reopened last week for the first time since the Taliban's mid-August takeover.

node.title: Tree of Life Synagogue, Site of 2018 Shooting, Gets $6.6M for Memorial and Worship Space
node.description: The grant will create a memorial space for the victims of the 2018 shooting, to be designed by Daniel Libeskind, who led the redesign of the World Trade Center.

node.title: Gathering and cooking food on Country isn't just about culture, it's about sustainability
node.description: The ABC's Rulla Kelly-Mansell travelled to the Top End for his new show Cooking on Country, and hopes it will inspire others to better appreciate and understand native foods and ingredients.

node.title: What will the opening of Queensland's borders mean for the state's least-vaccinated regions?
node.description: With a week until the Queensland border reopens, authorities have warned that the virus will come and "hunt down" the unvaccinated.

node.title: How to host an affordable and cheerful Aussie Christmas
node.description: Christmas does not have to be a time of overspending, overeating and plastic waste. Here's how one family on the NSW coast creates a distinctly Australian festive season.

node.title: 265,000 new dwellings in pipeline over next five years - MBIE report
node.description: Ministry of Business Innovation and Employment's National Construction Pipeline Report forecast 265,000 new dwellings would be consented between now and December 2026.

node.title: Claude Humphrey, Pillar of N.F.L. Falcons’ ‘Grits Blitz,’ Dies at 77
node.description: He was belatedly inducted into the Hall of Fame, having played before sacks were an official statistic. He ended his career with a Super Bowl team, the Eagles.

node.title: Hyun Sook Han, Korean Social Worker and Adoption Pioneer, Dies at 83
node.description: Over three decades, she placed thousands of Korean orphans with families in the Midwest and made sure the children never forgot their heritage.

node.title: Russia finds its first two cases of the Omicron variant in travelers from South Africa.
node.description: By Valerie Hopkins

node.title: NSW south coast businesses grapple with 'diabolical' staff shortages ahead of predicted bumper summer
node.description: Job vacancies across the NSW south coast have skyrocketed by more than 17 per cent in the past month, and businesses are cutting back opening hours and cancelling live music to deal with it.

node.title: Some cancer patients face higher risks than others. But these women are hoping to change that
node.description: Navigating the healthcare system can be tough, and cancer patients from multicultural backgrounds can face more risks and challenges than the general population. But a university project and support from women with lived experience is helping make treatment safer.

node.title: Justice Dept. Files Voting Rights Suit Against Texas Over New Map
node.description: The department said the state’s redistricting plan would violate the Voting Rights Act by discriminating against minority voters.

node.title: Belarus Bans E.U., U.K., Airlines, Western Imports as Part of Retaliatory Sanctions
node.description: The ban on western imports is retaliation to what Belarus says is an "illegal external sanctions pressure aimed at undermining the sovereignty of Belarus."

node.title: Black Ferns player says coaches comments led to mental breakdown
node.description: Black Ferns hooker Te Kura Ngata-Aerengamate has accused the coaching staff of making disparaging comments that led to her suffering from anxiety and hyperventilation.

node.title: Principals, teachers more stressed and exhausted than last year - ERO survey
node.description: The pandemic is taking an increasingly heavy toll on school teachers and children, a survey has found.

node.title: Farm production tipped to break record $78b this financial year
node.description: The value of all that is farmed in Australia is tipped to break a new record this year.

node.title: Cricket match brings Afghan interpreters and ADF veterans together to heal wounds
node.description: Afghan interpreters and Australian veterans who served on the front lines in Afghanistan come together over a game of cricket in an effort to acknowledge and heal from their experiences during the decades-long war.

node.title: 'They have him': Tim Gunn's quarantine escape and capture seen through government emails
node.description: Email exchanges obtained by the ABC show Tasmania's governmental agencies trying to work out how Tim Gunn was able to flee hotel quarantine, with news of him being taken back into custody communicated in a one-line email as "they have him".

node.title: 'One of his favourites': Second of four women takes stand at Ghislaine Maxwell trial
node.description: A woman, testifying under the pseudonym Kate, tells a New York court she massaged Jeffrey Epstein at Ghislaine Maxwell's request and had sexual encounters with him as a teenager.

node.title: Triple whammy: Day of chaos looms in NSW as train drivers, bus drivers and teachers walk off the job
node.description: The state government is facing growing pressure to lift public sector wages as unions warn of a summer of disruption ahead.

node.title: U.S. announces diplomatic boycott of Beijing Winter Olympics
node.description: The White House cited China's "egregious" human rights abuses.

node.title: Justice Department sues Texas over redistricting, alleging discrimination
node.description: The suit alleges that Texas has "again diluted the voting strength of minority Texans."

node.title: Storm Could Cause ‘Catastrophic Flooding’ in Hawaii, Forecasters Warn
node.description: Some parts of the islands could see as much as 25 inches of rain through Tuesday, meteorologists said. “This is an extreme weather event,” an emergency official said on Monday.

node.title: United States Will Not Send Government Officials to Beijing Olympics
node.description: Athletes will still be able to compete in the Winter Games in Beijing, but the diplomatic boycott is a response to human rights abuses in Xinjiang.

node.title: Police Called to British Parliament After Traces of Cocaine Reportedly Found
node.description: A drug wipe test found that 11 of the 12 restrooms tested showed traces of cocaine. The restrooms were accessible only to those with parliamentary passes.

node.title: Medina Spirit, Who Tested Positive For Steroids After Winning Kentucky Derby, Dies On Track
node.description: The horse has been at the center of controversy after he won the Derby and later tested positive for the drug betamethasone, an anti-inflammatory steroid.

node.title: Group Formed to Support Trump Now Working with Wisconsin GOP to Change How Elections Run
node.description: The measure would set the same hours and days for early voting across every state community and have some communities alter how they count absentee ballots.

node.title: What you need to consider if you're planning to travel overseas with your unvaccinated kids
node.description: Radhika is travelling to India to visit family and friends after a long time of separation due to border closures. But she's "anxious" about going overseas with her children who are not yet eligible for a COVID-19 vaccine.
